Upon placing the canine’s head on their own, the humans had full sight, could hear like a dog, and more importantly, could eat solid foods. The animal’s jaw structure reshaped, allowing human speech, its head resizing to fit on a human neck. From that point on, humans required an animal companion to survive. It would be found through trial and error that the animal’s body was needed, with its head allowing the same effect on it, and that the death of the body would mean the death of the head, and in many cases, the linked human. Over a few generations, bonds forned between a hunan and an animal, with bonded animals lifespans being equal to that of a human. Mating involved a four partner relationship rather than two. The history of Earth, was forever changed.

Now, keeping in mind that canines aren’t the only animals humans bonded with, with felines, equines, bovines, and other domesticated animals being popular, do you wish to continue this story track?
13331.title: Symbiotic relationship

13332.content:
You begin typing out the abilities and history, going into relative detail.
“For a few centuries due to a magical comet that passed too close to earth, humans and mammals alike have been able to be pulled apart, also known as modular. By pulling at the joints, a part would come off, leaving a fleshy or furry stump behind. Consciousness could be transferred between the body or the head, leaving either to become the “mind” of what ever parts are attached to it, or were attached last.
History wise, things are pretty much the same, with the ability largely going unused for a few centuries due to religious and political pressures, although a black market of parts did spring up. Now, with the pressures suppressing the abilities lessening up, that black market has become more public, with a few part shops popping up every so often.
Now it’s not unusual to see people with mismatched parts, extra or less parts, or even those of animals. While some regulations have come into place, it’s less of a taboo now than before.”
Hitting send, you feel the rush as a wave of magic pulses around the planet. Around you things begin to change. But how much do you change?

133332.content: This is the option to create a world populated entirely by anthropomorphic animals. This is basically the transformation of both human and animal populations worldwide to create a bigger community. They can behave like ordinary animals, but they walk on two legs, wear clothes, do human things and speak like humans. Meat and other animal-derived products, or products similar to them, can exist but must be explained. Other than that, anything goes.

14.content:
An animal. Or rather your dog.
“My beloved dog Cassie has two heads who both speak human.”
Just then you look over to your dog nearby and see that she indeed does have two heads.
Walking over to pet her, you notice one of your pictures on your wall. She had two heads in it too. And in a couple other pictures around the room.
Giving her a light scratch behind the ears, one of her heads yawn, waking up. “Ahhh. Oh hello Master Calvin. You feeling ok?”
“Master? Since when can you talk?”
She cocked her head at that, looking confused. “What do you mean? I’ve always been able too since I was a pup, and you saved me from that lab.”
“Oh, heh, right. Sorry girl. So, remind me, how smart are you again?”
“As smart as a human, thanks to those experiments.” She started to stretch, her other head staying asleep. “Ahh, much needed.” She looked over at your computer, grinning lightly. “Trying your hand at writing again huh Master?”
“Huh? Oh, yeah. I got a new copy of word from a friend, so I’m just testing it out.”
“Mind if I see what you’ve got?”
“O-oh sure, go right ahead.”
She got up and walked over to the computer, reading what little you’ve got so far. “Writing about me again huh?”
“Mmmhmm. Who else?”
“Jeez Cal, the amount you write about me, I might as well be your girlfriend. Not like it would be weird or anything. I’m basically a human in a dog body. Why not make me that in your story then?”
With the reality altering properties of the program clear, do you make her your girlfriend, do you alter her a little more, or do you move on to your next target?
14.title: Your dog.

141211.content:
“All members of the species Canis lupus have human bodies,” you type. “They are capable of human speech, wear clothes, are masters (like humans) of walking on two legs, can use technology, and there is even a number of towns and cities where they are the only inhabitants. Where the city is shared with humans, they have their own neighborhoods all to themselves. They have their own countries: Canis in the region of western China and Central Asia, Angamanain and Nacumera & Kashmir in South Asia, Anubis in Africa and Lycaon in Europe. Canis has a history of monarchy and empire, but is now a republic that was once under the influence of the Soviet Union and associated Communist government for 40 years. It is currently under fledging democratic government. Angamanain and Nacumera is an island kingdom in the Bay of Bengal, where the Andaman and Nicobar Islands would be. Angamanain is the larger northern island in this island chain; Nacumera is the smaller southern island. Kashmir, in the area of Northern India and Northeast Pakistan, has had a canine ruling dynasty for thousands years, with a brief alignment with Britain between 1846-1948. Anubis is a small republic located in the region of Southern Egypt and Northern Sudan. It is named after the canine-headed Egyptian god of the dead. Lycaon is located in the area of North Serbia and South Hungary. Like Canis, it used to be a Communist republic, and before that, a kingdom and even earlier a principality. The capital city of Canis is located in the area of the city of Kashgar. The capital of Angamanain and Nacumera, where the country’s king resides with his mother, is in the area of Port Blair. The capital of Kashmir lies between Srinagar and Jammu. The capital of Anubis is in the Halaib area. The capital of Lycaon is in the area of Novi Sad. All these countries are part of the United Nations.”

You turn your attention to Cassie. “One of my friends, Cassie, is a canine, specifically a dog. Her father works in the police, her mother works in the civil service, she has 4 siblings - an identical twin sister, Jenny, an older brother, Kevin, a older sister, Suzanne, and a younger brother, Lucas. They live in the house next door to mine.”

“In the United States and certain other nations, canines have many of the same rights as humans, able to vote in elections, hold jobs, interact with humans, form groups and move freely. It is possible for a human to adopt a canine as long as it is a dog. In fact, Australia has a state controlled by dingoes, where the Northern Territory would be. In all areas, romance is possible between humans and canines, but they produce infertile offspring in all cases.”

Once you’re done, you turn to look at Cassie. While one of her heads is still there, her body is now that of a human female like something out of Mars Attacks!, and she wears a blue t-shirt, navy trousers and red running shoes. Beside her is a similar woman who has a similar head and is wearing a similar outfit. You correctly assume this is Jenny, the twin you created, and that she formed from Cassie’s second head.
141211.title: Yes

choices: A single dog with two heads

14321.content:
Alright, now that the target is set, you just need to decide the change...

Want to make all animals anthropomorphic?
14321.title: Earth animals

143211.content:
You have a pretty precise picture in mind, but you want to give some free range to the scenario, so you decide to write it as a news article and leave some things develop themselves
You begin to type:
Recently a new powerful virus has spread on the planet. The virus thrives by acquiring DNA from humans and then implanting it in other Animals. Scientists are still not sure why this virus need to do all this back and forth, but everyone is surprised by the results. All the infected Animals in the span of a couple of weeks assume definite anthropomorphic characteristics, like opposable thumbs, bipedal stance, more humanised face features and chest breasts in the females. This latter characteristic is especially weird in non- mammal species like snakes, that come to resemble the mythical creature known as a naga. Some of the worst cases encountered yet caused a variation of the subjects' diet towards a more omnivorous one or the subject to developing, lenghtening and/or chance of color of hair on the head. The virus doesn't affect the animal's size. No known affected specimen developed speech or any increase of intelligence yet, even though they seem to have an eerie increased comprehension of the local human language. The connection to the human source's known languages is yet to demonstrate. What is certain is that they can't or don't want to get around any kind of restraint humans apply to them. Affected dogs, for example, even if now are in posses of perfectly working hands of dexterity comparable to humans, never once tried to get rid of their leashes, collars or any other kind of bind to their freedom. Other experiments carried on affected lab rats, cows and even lizards have shown the inability of them to utilize tools, like before the infection occurred. Strangely though, the affected specimens seem to be interested to dress up, even though they do not seem to be driven by embarrassment or shame. They will put on any clothing article that both fits them and their gender. If they believe the clothes in question belongs to somebody, they tend to hang around the area where they found them, waiting for the supposed owner's approval before going away. They will take off without any problem every clothes they are asked to, if the request comes from the clothes' owner, from the animal's owner or one of the members of the owner's 'pack', from a caretaker or if they feel like it. They will however not hand back the clothes to somebody that's not the owner or caretaker of either the animal or the clothes.
Lastly, flying animals and sea creatures seem to be immune to the virus, and thus haven't been affected in any way.

You put the date of a couple of months back at the end of the paper and save the document.
After a couple of seconds, you hear a big whoosh around you and your room seems to spin.
Wondering if it worked you get to the kitchen, just in time for the news. One of the leading titles is about the new researches that scientists are doing on birds to find the immunity factor, how the virus managed to affect existing anatomy, if there was a way to control the virus to be able to affect existing anathomy to archieve, say, true genetic gender change or drastic variations in anathomy, like multiple heads, limbs regrowth and all the like, and to make sure that the virus wasn't going to mutate humans too.
At the end of the article, somebody joins you in the kitchen. It's...
143211.title: Yas

1432111.content: Is it Cassie, the two headed, human speaking female dog? Is she that's been affected by your last change?
1432111.title: A family pet, already affected

You decide to turn all mammals into humanoids.
“All non-human mammal species have human-like bodies, with the addition of tails sticking out their rear ends. They are capable of human speech, can wear clothes, have the right to hold jobs in many countries, are masters (like humans) of walking on two legs, can use technology, and there is even a number of towns and cities where they are the only inhabitants. Where the city is shared with humans, they have their own neighborhoods all to themselves. Many wild species such as wolves, lions, tigers, bears, deer, monkeys, rhinoceroses, elephants, armadillos, anteaters, foxes, water buffaloes, kangaroos, dingos, coyotes, otters, jaguars, leopards, zebras, hyenas and wild sheep are traditionally tribal, but some have moved into cities. It is possible to humans to, and completely within their right to, adopt a cat, dog, rabbit, ferret, gerbil, hamster, pig, chinchilla, rat, guinea pig, skunk, hedgehog, horse or mouse. On farms, cows, bulls, pigs, horses, donkeys, alpacas, camels, goats, llamas and sheep can all serve as farmhands as well as humans. Technology exists that allows mammals to regulate their environment artificially to make them more comfortable.”
Do you stop there?

You decide to turn all mammals into humanoids.
“All mammals of all species, including domestic mammals, have human bodies. They are capable of human speech, can wear clothes, have the right to hold jobs in many countries, are masters (like humans) of walking on two legs, can use technology, and there is even a number of towns and cities where they are the only inhabitants. Where the city is shared with humans, they have their own neighborhoods all to themselves. Many wild species such as wolves, lions, tigers, bears, deer, monkeys, rhinoceroses, elephants, armadillos, anteaters, foxes, water buffaloes, kangaroos, dingos, coyotes, otters, jaguars, leopards, zebras, hyenas and wild sheep are traditionally tribal, but some have moved into cities. It is possible to humans to, and completely within their right to, adopt a cat, dog, rabbit, ferret, gerbil, hamster, pig, chinchilla, rat, guinea pig, skunk, hedgehog, horse or mouse. On farms, cows, bulls, pigs, horses, donkeys, alpacas, camels, goats, llamas and sheep can all serve as farmhands as well as humans. Do you stop there?

154211.content:
You have long been fascinated by the human-like beings known as cynocephali, so called because of their dog-like heads. You decide you want to add them to the world.

First you must specify what your world’s newest inhabitants are. Before typing anything, you go online and find a Reddit post on cynocephali in a fantasy setting (https://www.reddit.com/r/worldbuilding/c...). You see a man with a Airedale Terrier’s head In what you believe to be 1910’s or 1920’s get-up, a woman with a Labrador’s head in Victorian or Edwardian dress, a North African man with a Jackal’s head, an Australian Aboriginal man with a dingo’s head, a Inuit/Eskimo woman with a wolf’s head and a Native American woman with a coyote’s head. You copy the details written on the creatures on a piece of paper, since this will be the last time you see it.

Going back to Word, you start writing your alternations to the world. “The cynocephali are an intelligent species which are native to Earth, sharing it with humans,” you type, “They are essentially humans with dog heads, although they vary from place to place. A cynocephalus may have the head of any member belonging to the genusCanis, and the body of any human race. Cynocephali are classified under their own genus, Cynocephalus, and are divided into several species: Cynocephalus lupus, the Eurasian cynocephali (also collectively known as ‘werewolves’, ‘wolfmen’, wolf cynocephali or lupocephali), who have the heads of any member of the wolf species Canis lupus; Cynocephalus coyote, the American cynocephali, (also known as the coyote cynocephali), who have the heads of any member of the coyote species Canis latrans; Cynocephalus chacal, the African cynocephali (also known as the jackal cynocephali), three genetic related subspecies who have the heads of the various jackal species, the golden jackal (Canis aureus), the black-backed jackal (Canis mesomelas) and the side-striped jackal (Canis adustus); Cynocephalus dingo, the Australian cynocephali (also known as the dingo cynocephali), who have the heads of the dingo species, Canis dingo, and are one of only two cynocephalus species without racial variety concerning human bodies as they all boast the bodies of Australian Aboriginals; Cynocephalus simensis, the Ethiopian cynocephali who have the heads of Ethiopian wolves (Canis simensis) and the other cynocephalus species without racial variety regarding human bodies as they have the bodies of native Ethiopians; Cynocephalus anubis, the Anubi (also known as the Egyptian cynocephali), which have the heads of African golden wolves (Canis anthus); and Cynocephalus canis, the youngest species, the true cynocephali. By some unknown means, the true cynocephali have developed a biological mechanism that causes their heads to mimic that of any breed of domestic dogs, explaining their other name of ‘dog cynocephali’. The natural ranges of the Eurasian cynocephali, the American cynocephali, the African cynocephali, the Australian cynocephali, the Ethiopian cynocephali and the Anubis are closely similar to that of the Canis species that their heads resembles (despite their name, the Eurasian cynocephali are also present in North America, where their heads resemble red wolves, eastern wolves and other American varieties of wolf, as well as Europe and Asia). The true cynocephali first appeared in Asia thousands of years thanks to a mutation in the local Eurasian cynocephali population. Overall, the cynocephali evolved from different species of canine that are now extinct.

“All cynocephali have 62 chromosomes - halfway between the number for humans and the number for dogs. The number includes 30 pairs of autosomal chromosomes and two sex chromosomes.”

“The social behaviour of cynocephali is like that of wolves, coyotes, dingoes or jackals - they operate in packs, although ‘lone wolf’ cynocephali are not unheard of. They are territorial and often tribal, and act aggressively if threatened or intimidated. Their gestation periods last for five months, and litters are not uncommon. They are good at communicating with canines, and can understand human language. Some have even learnt to speak human language. They are resourceful with tools, and can wear clothes.

“Years ago, cynocephali were treated by some humans as barbarians, associated with cannibalism. Others revered them - for example, in Egypt, the Anubi were treated as the emissaries of the god of the dead in Egyptian mythology, who they believed was an Anubis. Today, they have a presence in some cities and towns in many countries, although they typically do not live among humans - understandable, since humans and cynocephali cannot interbreed. There are some cities and towns where they are the only inhabitants. They have their own countries: Canis in the region of western China and Central Asia, Angamanain and Nacumera & Kashmir in South Asia, Anubis in Africa and Lycaon in Europe. Canis has a history of monarchy and empire, but is now a republic that was once under the influence of the Soviet Union and associated Communist government for 40 years. It is currently under fledging democratic government. Angamanain and Nacumera is an island kingdom in the Bay of Bengal, where the Andaman and Nicobar Islands would be. Angamanain is the larger northern island in this island chain; Nacumera is the smaller southern island. Kashmir, in the area of Northern India and Northeast Pakistan, has had a cynocephali ruling dynasty for thousands years, with a brief alignment with Britain between 1846-1948. Anubis is a small republic located in the region of Southern Egypt and Northern Sudan. It is named after the Anubi who rule the area. Lycaon is located in the area of North Serbia and South Hungary. Like Canis, it used to be a Communist republic, and before that, a kingdom and even earlier a principality. The capital city of Canis is located in the area of the city of Kashgar. The capital of Angamanain and Nacumera, where the country’s king resides with his mother, is in the area of Port Blair. The capital of Kashmir lies between Srinagar and Jammu. The capital of Anubis is in the Halaib area. The capital of Lycaon is in the area of Novi Sad. The area that would be Australia’s Northern Territory is controlled by Australian cynocephali, who run an autonomous state under Australian influence.”

So now that you’ve fleshed out your new world, what do you do?
154211.title: Cynocephali

info.description:
10 October 2014: 100 Chapters!

You buy a strange piece of Microsoft Word software from a yard sale. As you type, you see that when you type info about certain people, they change.

Main characters:

You (Calvin Howard): 23, 5'8", planning to get a job as a professional author, lives with his family, in the process of searching for his own place
Janice Howard, your older sister: 25, 5'7", model, is too looking for her own place
Beth Howard, your younger sister: 17, 5'6", popular cheerleader, star pupil
Diana Howard, your mother: 50, 5'5", church secretary
Paul Howard, your father: 52, 6', construction worker
Mila Gennezi, your girlfriend, 22, 5'7", real estate agent

RULES:
You have the power to type anything.
This family has a great relationship, so no family members going psychotic. It's creepy.
Only you, or whoever else is typing in Word, can see the changes.
No killing anyone.
Keep dirty sex scenes, if any, to a minimum. I will allow this.
No incest, please!!! Seriously!
